Explained: How America’s biggest bank enabled 'superclient' Jeffrey Epstein
description: JPMorgan is not just any bank. With nearly $4 trillion in assets and operations spanning more than 100 countries, it is consistently ranked as the world’s most systemically important financial institution. Regulators and investors alike see it as a bellwether for industry standards. This makes its failings more consequential than most: when the biggest US bank overlooks red flags, it risks signalling to peers that profit can trump compliance. As the New York Times investigation shows, that was precisely the dynamic at play with Epstein.

description: Vanessa Bryant playfully addressed pregnancy rumors while enjoying a cocktail at the US Open Finals in New York. She shared pictures on Instagram, twinning with her daughters Bianka and Capri, and humorously commented on the ongoing speculation. Bryant previously shut down the rumors with a social media post, emphasizing she's protecting her peace and having fun.

title: Nepal protests: Apart from social media ban, what led to the ‘GenZ’ agitation in which 14 are dead
Khejuri BJP workers’ deaths: Calcutta HC casts doubt on investigating officer
VP polls: 25 legal luminaries criticise Reddy-Lalu meet; call it 'dismaying'
description: A group of legal experts has strongly criticized opposition vice-presidential candidate B. Sudershan Reddy for meeting with Lalu Prasad Yadav, a politician convicted in a major corruption case. They argue that this association raises concerns about Reddy's judgment and his commitment to national interests, especially given his aspirations for high office.

title: Inspector Zende recalls what happened after he arrested Charles Sobhraj the second time: ‘Dilip Kumar booked a hotel room, Lata Mangeshkar asked for autograph; Rajiv Gandhi stopped his car to…’
Massive outrage in Nepal: 26 apps blocked including Facebook, WhatsApp - full list of banned apps
description: Nepal is facing widespread protests following the government's ban on 26 social media platforms, including Facebook, YouTube and X, due to non-compliance with registration rules. Demonstrations erupted over corruption allegations and the social media restrictions, resulting in clashes with police, leading to casualties and injuries. Prime Minister Oli defended the ban, prioritizing national independence over potential job losses.

title: ‘I’ve been unwell for over a year…’: As comedian Zakir Khan cuts back on touring to prioritise health, an expert shares critical signs signalling need for rest
‘Walks like Rajinikanth’: children mob Gukesh as he arrives for FIDE Grand Swiss Round 4, video goes viral
‘I was disrespected by Punjab Kings… felt like depression mode’: Chris Gayle reveals reason for walking out of IPL 2021
‘Full marks for efforts’: 4 Rajasthan students hire helicopter to reach exam centre in Uttarakhand amid flood
Tear gas, curfews and the Gen Z uprising in Nepal. 10 key questions answered
Why Alcaraz vs Sinner is tennis’s most fascinating rivalry today
Madras HC issues interim order restraining makers of Ajith Kumar’s Good Bad Ugly from using Ilaiyaraaja’s songs
Apple iPhone 17 Launch Event 2025 Live Streaming: How to watch Apple September keynote event live stream in India
Massive crowd turns up in Birmingham to see Kareena Kapoor Khan, actor recreates ‘Fevicol Se’: ‘It is in my blood’
First legislator detained under PSA, who is AAP’s lone J&K MLA Mehraj Malik?

Anthropic CEO repeats his AI warning which created 'outrage' and sparked debate
description: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei predicts AI will eliminate entry-level white-collar jobs in law, consulting, administration, and finance within five years. He claims AI is already proficient at repetitive tasks and improving rapidly. Amodei reveals CEOs privately view AI as a cost-cutting tool, contradicting public narratives.

title: Aryna Sabalenka reigns again: Wins 2nd US Open; gets another custom WWE belt
description: Aryna Sabalenka secured her second straight US Open title in 2025, defeating Amanda Anisimova. This victory marks her fourth major title, adding to her previous Australian Open wins. Celebrating her triumph, Sabalenka received a custom WWE belt, a repeat gift from her 2024 win. She avenged her Wimbledon loss against Anisimova, showcasing her dominance in women's tennis.

title: Why TikTok escaped Nepal’s social media ban and the list of sites that went dark
T20I Hat-tricks: Full list of bowlers to record hat-tricks in T20I cricket after Mohammad Nawaz’s feat against Afghanistan
Selfie and beach fun turn tragic, 5 students drown in Karnataka
How Asha Bhosle ruled Instagram 40 years after this song’s release, which Gen-Z couldn’t get enough of
After fresh threat inputs and assessment, Home Ministry reassigns Vice-President’s security from Delhi Police to CRPF
From ‘Modi’s war’ to ‘Kremlin’s laundromat’, Peter Navarro’s India-focused rhetoric
OnePlus Nord Buds 3r review: Rich audio, great battery life
J&K’s only AAP MLA is first legislator to be detained under Public Safety Act for a year
Aaron Rodgers' love life: Shailene Woodley to Munn; what went wrong?
description: Shailene Woodley, Olivia Munn, and Danica Patrick, former partners of Aaron Rodgers, have recently shared their challenging experiences in relationships with him. Woodley described feeling lost and battling depression, while Munn felt trapped in a tumultuous family dynamic. Patrick characterized her relationship with Rodgers as emotionally abusive, highlighting the significant impact it had on her self-confidence and well-being.

title: Macrobiotic coach says traditional Indian-style toilet systems are the ultimate health hack: ‘Your organs would begin healing’

Asia Cup 2025: Ex-batter issues warning — 'India need a new winning combination'
description: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has cautioned that India might face challenges in the Asia Cup 2025 due to the absence of a third all-rounder. He emphasised the importance of having multiple all-rounders, recalling India's T20 World Cup victory where Hardik Pandya, Axar Patel, and Ravindra Jadeja provided crucial balance.

title: Hazratbal row: BJP targets Rahul after Cong MP's 'what's done is done' remark
description: Following the defacement of the National Emblem in Jammu & Kashmir, a political storm has erupted. Congress leader Tariq Anwar's dismissive remark, "What's done is done," drew sharp criticism from the BJP, who accused the Congress of supporting anti-national acts. Anwar defended his statement by referencing Omar Abdullah's assertion that religious sites don't feature the Ashok Chakra.

Crippling Russia's economy: EU explores new sanctions; joint action with US mulled
description: The EU is contemplating a 19th round of sanctions targeting Russian banks and energy firms to pressure Putin over Ukraine. These measures may include restrictions on payment systems, cryptocurrency exchanges, and oil commerce. The EU aims to align with the US, which is also considering actions like sanctions on Russia's oil tanker fleet.

title: After Shigeru Ishiba’s resignation, who could be Japan’s next Prime Minister?

10 years after boy’s remains found under Mumbai bridge, 3 accused cleared of murder charges; 1 of them convicted for kidnapping
Hajj 2026 in Oman: Registration opens soon, important dates and how to apply
description: The Ministry of Endowments and Religious Affairs in Oman has opened Hajj registration for the 1447 AH (2026) season from September 23 to October 8. Citizens and residents aged 18 and above can apply online through www.hajj.om. Selection is automatic based on Saudi Arabia’s quota. Applicants will be notified via SMS in October and November, with strict guidelines to ensure a smooth process.

title: 'Treated me like a kid': Gayle reveals painful IPL exit; says he walked out
description: Chris Gayle revealed his disillusionment and depression during his time with Punjab Kings in the IPL, feeling disrespected despite his contributions to the league. He recounted a tearful conversation with Anil Kumble and his decision to leave the team midway through the 2021 season, prioritizing his mental health over money.

title: When is Karwa Chauth 2025: Date, Moon Rise Timings, History, Rituals, Significance, and more details
Asia Cup 2025: 'He is most dangerous as opener'- Ravi Shastri backs Samson at the top
description: Shubman Gill's inclusion as vice-captain adds complexity to India's T20I top-order selection for the Asia Cup. While Gill's Test success highlights his leadership potential, Sanju Samson's impressive opening form, including three centuries and a high strike rate, makes him a strong contender. Ravi Shastri advocates for Samson to continue opening, emphasizing his game-changing ability at the top.

title: ‘Heroic operation’: Hamas hails Jerusalem attack, calls on Palestinians to ‘escalate confrontation’
‘India is super safe’: Russian woman living in India for 11 years shares 3 learnings; video viral
Birthday party shame: MP cops filmed dancing with women performers
description: In Datia, an ASI was suspended after a video showed him dancing objectionably with women at a constable's birthday party. Similarly, in Shivpuri, another ASI faced suspension for dancing with a wanted criminal and a woman, with a beer can visible in the video. Both incidents have prompted investigations and potential further disciplinary actions.

title: ‘Not citizenship proof’: SC directs poll panel to accept Aadhaar as 12th document in Bihar SIR
China’s e-commerce companies are getting singed by a price war
Who is Decarlos Brown Jr? Homeless offender charged in killing of Ukrainian refugee
description: Iryna Zarutska, a Ukrainian refugee seeking safety in the US, was fatally stabbed on a Charlotte light rail. Decarlos Brown Jr., a homeless man with a history of violent crime, has been charged with her murder. The incident has sparked outrage and criticism, raising concerns about public safety and the handling of repeat offenders.

title: Elgar Parishad case: SC to hear accused bail plea on medical grounds
Monopoly has a different meaning in an AI-driven world. The Google Chrome judgment in the US misses that
Bihar SIR: Consider Aadhaar, SC tells EC; clarifies it's not a citizenship proof
description: The Supreme Court has directed the Election Commission to explore including Aadhaar as a valid identity document for Bihar's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls. The court emphasized that Aadhaar should serve solely as proof of identity, not citizenship, ensuring only genuine citizens participate in voting.

title: Passenger trains to run at speed of up to 100 kmph on Mizoram’s Bairabi–Sairang railway line
Lalbaug Cha Raja immersion: over 100 mobile phones and several gold chains stolen in Mumbai
MP man floats ‘dead’ in pond for 20 minutes; jolts back to life as cops rush in
description: In a bizarre incident at Veerpur Dam, Gwalior, a man named Tinku Singh staged his own drowning for an Instagram reel, fooling onlookers and prompting a police response. Singh lay motionless in the water for 20 minutes, leading people to believe he was dead.

Ahead of PM Modi’s visit, politics heats up in Punjab as ruling AAP seeks funds instead of a ‘photo op’
Maharashtra polls 'stolen' claim: Cong alleges Trai blocked SMS outreach; regulator denies claim
description: Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (Trai) has denied Congress's allegation of rejecting their SMS application regarding a documentary on the Maharashtra 2024 elections. Trai clarified that it doesn't approve individual SMS templates and the rejection was by the service provider, STPL. Congress leaders criticized Trai's action, linking it to efforts to suppress information about alleged election fraud.

title: Bad Girl movie review: Coming-of-age Tamil film smashes patriarchy without bringing a hammer to it
Cabinet Secretary chairs interministerial meeting today, focus on timely GST 2.0 rollout on Sep 22
6.6 lakh students appear for West Bengal’s first-ever class 12 semester exam
Watch: M S Dhoni spotted in his vintage Rolls-Royce on Ranchi streets, young fan chases car
Nepal unrest over social media ban: Home minister resigns; 19 protesters killed
description: Thousands of young Nepalis protested in Kathmandu against the government's ban on 26 social media platforms, leading to clashes with police and multiple casualties. Demonstrators expressed anger over the blackout and broader frustration with corruption, chanting slogans and attempting to storm the Parliament. The government imposed curfews and justified the ban by citing non-compliance with local registration requirements.

title: In UP’s Kanpur, ‘objectionable’ WhatsApp post by 25-year-old sparks tension between two sects

Amaal Mallik ‘can handle toxicity like a boss’, says brother Armaan Malik as Salman Khan schools him on Bigg Boss 19
Red Sea Cables Cut: Microsoft shares update; services affected Middle East, Asia
description: Undersea cable cuts in the Red Sea have significantly disrupted internet services across regions including India, Saudi Arabia, Pakistan, and the UAE, causing slowed connectivity and increased latency. The disruptions, attributed to failures affecting the SMW4 and IMEWE cable systems near Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, highlight the Red Sea's critical role in global internet data flow, impacting cloud and network services.

title: Farah Khan defends Raj Kundra and Shilpa Shetty after visiting their home amid Rs 60 cr fraud allegation: ‘I don’t judge people…’
Nitish Katara murder case: SC refuses to extend interim bail of convict Vikas Yadav
Bus shooting in Jerusalem: Attackers open fire killing 6; video shows scenes of panic
J&K encounter: Two terrorists killed; soldier hurt in gunfight
description: A joint operation by the Army, CRPF, and J&K Police in Kulgam's Guddar forest led to an encounter with terrorists following specific intelligence inputs. The gunfight resulted in the elimination of two terrorists, while a junior commissioned officer sustained injuries during the exchange.

title: With Xavier Worthy hurt, Chiefs eye free-agent WR as clear solution
description: The Kansas City Chiefs are grappling with wide receiver depth issues after rookie Xavier Worthy's early-season shoulder injury. With Rashee Rice suspended and other receivers sidelined, the Chiefs may consider signing free agent veteran Kendrick Bourne to bolster their receiving corps. The upcoming game against the Philadelphia Eagles could influence their decision.

title: McDavid mindset contrasts with Tkachuk’s championship-first focus
description: Following consecutive Stanley Cup losses, the Edmonton Oilers face uncertainty as Connor McDavid's contract negotiations stall. McDavid's focus on individual achievements clashes with the team's desperate need for a championship, highlighted by Florida's emphasis on team unity. The Oilers' future hinges on whether McDavid prioritizes personal glory or leading Edmonton to its long-awaited Stanley Cup victory.

title: Youngest woman billionaire on dropping out; how parents reacted, money lessons
description: Lucy Guo, the youngest self-made billionaire, attributes her success to her frugal upbringing. Despite disappointing her immigrant parents by dropping out of Carnegie Mellon, she pursued the Thiel Fellowship. Guo's entrepreneurial spirit emerged early, hustling on the playground and selling virtual items online.
